dialogues.RANDY:
[1]Oh, my... look out! 
[2]Suplex! 
[3]Tombstone piledriver! 
[4]Catch you maniacs later... 
[5]C'mon, Len. Don't be such a fuckin' ballbreaker. 
[6]You know I'm good for it. 
[7]Can I at least park in back? 
[8]Thanks, Meg. 
[9]Hey, Wayne. 
[10]Do you have any extra shifts you could throw my way? 
[11]Pretty much anything weekday... 
[12]I tried Mexican sus once. Gave me bitch tits. 
[13]I don't want this. 
[14]I want my German. 
[15]Yeah? 
[16]Danke schoen. 
[17]How ya doin', Glor? 
[18]Don't leave it in too long. All those pieces broke off last time. 
[19]Right there, you post me. Hard. I show color. 
[20]You post me again. Again. You're fuckin' whalin' on my ass. 
[21]Who? 
[22]Ring rat? 
[23]What's up, kiddo? 
[24]Long time no see. 
[25]Whatcha doing here? Here to root on your old man? 
[26]That's okay----as long as you're not rooting against me! 
[27]I'm on in a sec. 
[28]What's up? 
[29]Amends? 
[30]Ohh... 12-stepper. 
[31]Good for you. That's great. 
[32]I do. 
[33]So's that it? 
[34]For what? 
[35]Okay... 
[36]Don't worry about it. 
[37]Sure. 
[38]It was about your mom. And me. Like, how I was bad. 
[39]Tonight's forecast calls for severe butt-whoopin's with a 100 percent chance of pain. 
[40]No problemo. 
[41]You know it, broski! 
[42]What? 
[43]They're fans. 
[44]I hafta. It's work. 
[45]I didn't ask them to come over. 
[46]Are we almost done with this? 
[47]This ATTACK. 
[48]Let's go home. 
[49]For you, needledick? Always. 
[50]Holy shit... 
[51]Whatcha thinkin'? 
[52]Yeah? 
[53]Think Bob'd get back in there? He's pretty retired. 
[54]Yo, Big Chris. 
[55]What do I look like, some fuckin' two-bit street dealer? 
[56]Swing by the mansion. Any day this week. 
[57]Thanks, hon. 
[58]Cassidy around? 
[59]Apologize to this lady. 
[60]You speak to her with respect. 
[61]No, it's not okay. This is definitely not okay. 
[62]I guarantee this woman's 50 times hotter than whatever goombah skank you're about to marry. 
[63]I was just trying to help. 
[64]You're right. I'm sorry. I'm sorry. 
[65]We're talking one of the historic matches in history. 20,000 people. Another million and a half watching at home on pay-per-view. 
[66]We were going back and forth, just killin' each other for a half hour. Any wrestling fan, they know all about it. 
[67]Yeah, it was big. So a rematch... 
[68]Goddamn you are smokin'. 
[69]Who knows. I put on a good show... 
[70]Could be the thing that gets me back on top. 
[71]Got cut tonight. 
[72]Ah, it's nothing. 
[73]How's this for fake? 
[74]1986. Denver Coliseum. Billy Bob Banjo hit me with his two-by-four. Loose nail tore the bicep open. 
[75]I got even better. 
[76]1988. Orlando Arena. Mr. Magnificent tossed me out of the ring. Landed on my shoulder, clavicle snapped in half. 
[77]Not when they're going crazy for you... 
[78]What's that? 
[79]Huh. I'll have to check it out. 
[80]What do I owe? 
[81]No prob. You're right on the way. 
[82]So how big's this place? 
[83]That place? 
[84]God bless hardcore... 
[85]Whatcha think? 
[86]Let's see if they got extension cords. 
[87]Call me Randy. 
[88]So how we lookin', doc? 
[89]Great. So I'm all good. 
[90]Like... 
[91]I could handle that. 
[92]I don't do coke. 
[93]Maybe once in a while. 
[94]So, like, wrestling... 
[95]What if I do it moderate? I could hold back on certain moves. There's always ways to fake---- 
[96]Randy. 
[97]With all due respect, Dr... 
[98]I want a second opinion. 
[99]I want a second opinion. 
[100]Yeah. 
[101]Yeah. 
[102]Yo, Adam! 
[103]Wanna play Nintendo? 
[104]What square? 
[105]It's a folding chair. 
[106]Yes, it's a chair. 
[107]1988 ain't old. 
[108]Shut up and fight. 
[109]Ready? 
[110]One more? 
[111]Don't you wanna get even? I whipped your butt. 
[112]Ah, I was just in the neighborhood. 
[113]Hey, feel like maybe grabbing a burger? 
[114]How `bout later, then? 
[115]Can we talk for a sec? 
[116]Someplace more quiet. 
[117]I had a heart attack. 
[118]I needed to talk to somebody. 
[119]Just a couple minutes. 
[120]Please. 
[121]In back. 
[122]Thanks. I appreciate it. 
[123]Last week. 
[124]Yeah, yeah. Feelin' much better. 
[125]It was while I was wrestling. I collapsed in the ring. 
[126]Yeah, it was pretty fucked up. 
[127]Tell ya, though, it was a big hit with the fans. Promoter told me everybody was hanging around wondering if I was okay, they wound up buying up all of his T-shirts and shit. Whole merch table got cleaned out. 
[128]Doctor says I can't wrestle no more. 
[129]I don't know. I don't know what to do. If I can't wrestle... 
[130]Time's all I got. I just sit there all day... 
[131]That's why I came to see you. 
[132]We don't really get along too good. 
[133]She don't need me. 
[134]I'm Randy The Ram. I've taken bigger bumps than this. 
[135]Maybe I'll give my daughter a call. 
[136]Why the fuck not? I'm her father. A person only gets one father in this life. 
[137]Unless you're adopted. 
[138]Definitely. 
[139]Hey... Is Stephanie home? 
[140]Her father. 
[141]Where you going? 
[142]Stephanie! 
[143]Can we talk? 
[144]Wait! Where ya going? 
[145]You in school? That's great. 
[146]What school? 
[147]What school? 
[148]Middlesex? That's kind of a hike. Where's your car? You taking the bus? Lemme give you a lift. 
[149]It's no problem. Really. I'm parked right by. 
[150]You're walking pretty fast there. You running late? I could help you with that. Give you a ride. 
[151]New Jersey Transit sucks! 
[152]Yes, ma'am! 
[153]There's something I wanted to tell you. 
[154]I had a heart attack. Last week. 
[155]I wanna try to fix things. 
[156]Why? 
[157]What? No. It's not like---- 
[158]What are you doing? 
[159]Stephanie! 
[160]Why not? 
[161]Sold the shit outta that one. 
[162]I gotta give credit. DiFusco came up with the idea. We're setting up an angle for a grudge match. 
[163]What minivan? 
[164]Looks great. 
[165]I'll start loosening up. 
[166]You got it, broski. 
[167]Hey. 
[168]Better. Good. 
[169]Good. Fine. 
[170]Not too good, actually. She tore me a new asshole. 
[171]I was thinking about maybe getting her a present. 
[172]I'm not sure. 
[173]22, 23? 22. 
[174]I don't know. 
[175]I'm a shitty fuckin' father. 
[176]That could work. 
[177]Yeah? 
[178]Okay. Cool. 
[179]Good tip. Thanks. 
[180]I'm gonna grab a drink at the bar. 
[181]That was fast. 
[182]Yeah? 
[183]All right. Thanks. 
[184]Hey, Wayne. Got a sec? 
[185]I was wondering if you had something more steady. Full-time. 
[186]That works. 
[187]What is it? 
[188]So, like, working with customers? 
[189]That's the only thing you got? 
[190]Hey. 
[191]I almost didn't recognize you. You look all... clean. 
[192]Like classy. 
[193]Nah, nah, I don't mean that bad. I like it. It's like in "Grease", where she turns into the hot rock `n' roll chick at the end. Except backwards. 
[194]So, uh... Should I call you Cassidy or Pam? 
[195]This is awesome... 
[196]She's kinda skinny, a little shorter than you. 
[197]Maybe. Not really. I'm not sure. 
[198]Not really... 
[199]Hey, Pam? 
[200]Thank you very much. 
[201]I think she might be a lesbian. 
[202]Does that help? 
[203]Ah, maybe she's just a friend. 
[204]What's that? The green. 
[205]It's perfect. 
[206]Thanks again. 
[207]I never woulda known about this place. 
[208]Man, I worked up a pretty good thirst in there. What say we grab a beer? 
[209]One beer! We gotta re-hydrate! 
[210]You have a kid? 
[211]I had no idea. 
[212]Boy or girl? 
[213]How old? 
[214]Wow... I had no friggin' idea. 
[215]Wait. 
[216]Now both our kids got something. 
[217]You're gonna turn this down, too? Man, you're rough! 
[218]Tell him to take good care of that. $300 bucks on eBay. 
[219]Nah. 
[220]He's a good-lookin' kid. 
[221]I see where he gets it from. 
[222]What's that? 
[223]You moving there? 
[224]What about Cheetah's? 
[225]Oh. Okay... 
[226]Hell, yeah. 
[227]C'mon. Let's dance. 
[228]Right here. 
[229]Who cares? Fuckin' Def Lep! 
[230]Fine. Then I'm dancing for you. 
[231]Just sit back and enjoy. 
[232]The lapdancer has become the lapdanced. 
[233]Take a bottle, shake it up/ Break the bubble, break it u-up... Pour some sugar on me! In the name of love! 
[234]They don't make `em like they used to. 
[235]Def Lep, Gunners... 
[236]Then that Cobain pussy had to come around and ruin it all. 
[237]Fuckin' mopey douchebag. "Ooh, look at me! I wear flannel! I'm all depressed!" 
[238]Nineties fuckin' sucked. 
[239]You're right. My bad. 
[240]What's up? 
[241]We just got here. 
[242]C'mon. You said one beer! 
[243]I thought it was gonna say Randy. 
[244]Do I really even need to wear one? 
[245]Yeah, but I---- 
[246]Could they maybe re-do it? 
[247]Seventeen. 
[248]Hang on, let me... 
[249]
[250]It'll just be a minute. 
[251]I guess it depends what you like. 
[252]Forty-six. 
[253]Sure. 
[254]Pesto change-o. 
[255]Wow. I am good. 
[256]Can I get you anything else? 
[257]You have yourself a nice day. 
[258]
[259]Bingo! 
[260]Anything in the case, sweetheart. 
[261]I think that can be arranged... 
[262]Do stalkers bring presents? 
[263]Well, I ain't a stalker. But... 
[264]Open it. 
[265]The "S" is for "Stephanie". 
[266]I got it just for you. 
[267]No reason. Just because. Do you like it? 
[268]I was looking in this store and saw it, and I just said, "That is it." 
[269]So what are you doing now? 
[270]Got any time? I was thinking we could swing by our old favorite spot. 
[271]You'll remember when you see. Whaddaya say? 
[272]What kinda things? 
[273]You ain't got stuff! C'mon, give an old man a break. 
[274]You really don't remember? 
[275]Guess you were pretty young. 
[276]There used to be this funhouse. The Monster Motel... 
[277]They had this cheesy-ass skeleton that popped out of a coffin. You'd get so scared, you'd cry. Then you'd beg to go in again. 
[278]You'd hop on my foot and wrap your arms around my leg. I'd have to walk you the whole way through like that. 
[279]I do. 
[280]I accept your apology. 
[281]Not like that. I just mean... You made amends. I free you. 
[282]Anything you've ever done or said or thought, I forgive. You've done nothing wrong to me. And anything I've ever done... I'm sorry. Truly. 
[283]I was young. My career was booming. All those lights, the fans, the crazy shit on the road... I wasn't thinking about my kid. Or my wife. 
[284]My priorities were all fucked up. I know that. But now... I wanna try to make things right. I wanna try to get to know you. I just hope it's not too late. 
[285]Hope that wasn't too painful. 
[286]Well... 
[287]Bye. 
[288]So... How about dinner sometime? 
[289]Maybe Tuesday? 
[290]Or not. That's cool, whatever... 
[291]Yo, Miggy. Ram. How ya doin'? Good, good. Listen, you're gonna have to count me out for Utica. I'm retiring. 
[292]Hey, how ya doin', Frank? Good, good. Listen... 
[293]Sorry, Volp. You know I'd kill to do it. I realize. I understand. No more. I'm done. I'm retired. Positive. It's time to move on. 
[294]Hey. Over here. 
[295]Open it. 
[296]I wanna watch. 
[297]Thank you. I couldn't've done it without you. 
[298]It was fun, right? We had a good time. 
[299]Shopping... 
[300]Hey, you ever been to Mother Kelly's? 
[301]They got this kick-ass cover band Tuesday nights. Play anything you can think of. What do you say we---- 
[302]What? 
[303]Do what? 
[304]I thought we had a little something going here. 
[305]But... 
[306]What if I do? 
[307]What about the other day? 
[308]Why? How? 
[309]What if we'd met someplace else? 
[310]But what if we did? 
[311]What if we did? 
[312]You say I don't know you, but you won't let me get to know you. 
[313]Yeah. I got it. 
[314]A lapdance. 
[315]You're refusing a customer? 
[316]Gimme a lapdance. 
[317]What? Am I a customer or not? 
[318]What's the matter? Not in the mood? So fake it. I'm just a stupid customer. 
[319]It doesn't mean anything. 
[320]C'mon, give the customer a lapdance. Shake your tits. Smile. 
[321]Pretend you like him. 
[322]I want a lapdance. 
[323]
[324]Can I help who's next? 
[325]Have a nice day. 
[326]Can I help who's next? 
[327]I don't think so. 
[328]Sorry, man. What can I getcha? 
[329]Nah. 
[330]Huh? 
[331]What's that? 
[332]Folks, we are ready to rumble... 
[333]I've never seen such determination! 
[334]Sleeper claw! 
[335]Piledriver! Just listen to this place! 
[336]Powerbomb! 
[337]Get in the ring! Get in the ring! Get in the ring! Get in the ring! 
[338]Yo, Brummy. 
[339]Yeah, good, good. 
[340]Well... I was thinking about maybe doing a reffing gig. 
[341]No wrestling, just reffing. Thought it might be fun. Shits `n' giggles. 
[342]`Sup, bro? 
[343]I really ain't lookin' to mix it up tonight. 
[344]That's okay. You guys do your thing. 
[345]One!... Two!... 
[346]By the time Ruckus fixes the tire, we've had so many Nyquil coladas we don't even realize we missed the damn gig! 
[347]Swear to God. Can't make stuff like that up. 
[348]You never heard that one? 
[349]Oh, man, fuckin' classic. 1990. Nashville Coliseum, Rage In The Cage II. I'm in the locker room shaving when behind me the stall door opens. I turn and there's Chris Columbo on the can taking a dump. He goes, "This is for Petrov", fuckin' wipes his ass, takes the shit-covered toilet paper and rubs it in his armpit. Five minutes later, he's in the ring with Petrov in a headlock, poor Petrov stuck there in CC's pit lookin' like he's gonna puke! 
[350]Dude's got taste. 
[351]Who's that? 
[352]Me neither. 
[353]Hey. 
[354]Is Stephanie home? 
[355]I'm so, so sorry. I completely, 
[356]I feel horrible. 
[357]I know I fucked up. I fucked up bad. 
[358]I'm trying to change. Really. I can't stand when I---- 
[359]Jesus! Stop! 
[360]Calm down! 
[361]Calm down! 
[362]You don't mean that! 
[363]
[364]I can change. 
[365]I know I can. 
[366]Let's get it onnn! 
[367]Nick. Randy The Ram... I wanna do it. Fanfest. I know, but I want back in. So call Bob, get the match back on. Pay me? Don't worry. Just cover my expenses. And pay Bob. Make sure he's there. I don't give a shit. I just wanna wrestle. 
[368]How'd you find me? 
[369]Good for you. Quitting's hard. 
[370]Got a match. 
[371]See ya later. 
[372]It's me. I promise I won't call you ever again. I'm going back to the ring. You were right about me. Everything you said. Anyway... I just wanted you to know... Your daddy loves you. That's all. 
[373]What's up, Bob? Yo, Carl. 
[374]Yeah, well, I'm here. 
[375]When you get settled in, we should go over things. 
[376]Y'know, the spots. 
[377]You don't wanna hash it out? 
[378]We should have at least a basic plan. 
[379]Ready to do this? 
[380]What are you doing here? 
[381]This ain't the best time to talk. 
[382]What about your heart? 
[383]I'll be fine. 
[384]They always say that. Whatever you got. 
[385]I know what I'm doing in there. Out here's where I get hurt. 
[386]Fuck the real world. Nobody gives a shit about me in the real world. 
[387]Listen to them! This is where I'm great. This is where I belong. 
[388]I gotta go. 
[389]I'll see you after the show. 
[390]Enjoy the show. 
[391]I just got one thing to say to you people... 
[392]Thank you. 
[393]You take your lumps and bruises in this game. But you know what? It's all worth it. Because of you guys. Your cheers keep me young. They make me feel alive. In 1982, the year I wrestled my first professional match, I was six- foot-one. By 1993, I was five-foot- eleven. Three back surgeries in 11 years knocked two full inches off my height. I may be down to five- eleven, but performing in front of you people has always made me feel 10 feet tall. And that's the way it's always gonna be. 
[394]Forever. 
[395]You're workin' pretty light here. 
[396]Anytime you wanna join in. 
[397]Much. 
[398]It's time. 
[399]Let's do this.
dialogues.CASSIDY:
[1]Sorry, guys, she's on break. 
[2]There's nothing like experience. I've done things your little fiancee's never dreamed of... 
[3]I got this. It's okay. 
[4]Thanks a lot. That was 200 bucks just walked out. 
[5]Did I ask for help? Did I need help? 
[6]Then don't fuckin' help. 
[7]That's okay. 
[8]Good to see ya, man. 
[9]Million and a half? Shit. 
[10]You never know who's in that crowd. 
[11]Jesus. 
[12]You're bleeding. 
[13]You okay? 
[14]And they say wrestling's fake. 
[15]What's that from? 
[16]Ow. Fuck. 
[17]Doesn't it hurt? 
[18]"He was pierced for our transgressions, He was crushed for our iniquities. The punishment that brought us peace was upon Him, and by His wounds we were healed." 
[19]It's from "Passion of the Christ". You never seen it? 
[20]Dude, you gotta. It's amazing. 
[21]It's, like, so inspiring. They throw everything at Him. Whips, arrows, rocks... Just beat the living fuck out of Him for the whole two hours. And He just takes it. 
[22]The sacrificial Ram... 
[23]Ah, shit. 
[24]Just gimme for three. 
[25]You'll wait `til I'm done? 
[26]Hey, sweetie. You're back soon. 
[27]I'm working. 
[28]You okay? 
[29]Sure. What's up? 
[30]Randy, I can't leave with a customer. 
[31]Shit. When? 
[32]You can't talk here? 
[33]Randy, I don't do that. 
[34]Where are you parked? 
[35]Go to your car. I'll meet you out there in 15 minutes. 
[36]That's okay. 
[37]I'm sorry. That's fucked up, dude. 
[38]When was it? 
[39]You okay? 
[40]Good, good. What happened? 
[41]Oh, man. That's terrible. 
[42]That's funny. 
[43]Damn. What are you gonna do? 
[44]It just happened. You don't have to figure everything out this second. Give yourself some time. 
[45]You really shouldn't be alone right now. 
[46]Randy... 
[47]I feel bad what happened. But you and me... I can't go there. 
[48]You should be with family now. You have a daughter, right? Where is she? 
[49]It doesn't matter. You need her. 
[50]Everybody needs a father. Trust me. 
[51]I'm sorry. I gotta get back in. 
[52]You take care of yourself. 
[53]You gonna be okay? 
[54]I'm sure. 
[55]You should. 
[56]Exactly. 
[57]You're gonna be just fine. 
[58]Would you like a lapdance, sweetie? 
[59]Would you like a lapdance? 
[60]Hey. How ya feeling? 
[61]How'd it go with your daughter? 
[62]Yeah? 
[63]You sure? 
[64]Shit. That sucks. 
[65]It's tough. You can't give up. You gotta keep trying. 
[66]That's a great idea! What's she into? 
[67]How old is she? 
[68]What kind of music does she like? 
[69]Is she into books? Cooking? 
[70]How could you not know? She's your daughter. 
[71]She's 22? Okay... You should get her some clothes, some kinda clothes... All girls like that. 
[72]I know the perfect place. This kick- ass little vintage shop in Westfield. 
[73]Saturday's the best time to go. That's when they get the new stuff in, all these boxes full of great shit. 
[74]I'll write it down. 
[75]I'm pretty sure it's on 28. 
[76]You got it. 
[77]Listen... 
[78]How `bout I meet you there Saturday? Help you out. 
[79]I'm actually gonna be running around right in that area anyway, so it's not really a pain. 
[80]No problem. You got it. 
[81]Hey. 
[82]"Clean"? 
[83]Gee, thanks. 
[84]Oh-kaay... 
[85]Pam. But don't get used to it. 
[86]Do you know her size? 
[87]Could you see her in this? 
[88]What about this? 
[89]So like, what is she? Goth? Punk? Hippie? Preppy? Stoner? 
[90]Yeah? 
[91]You're welcome. 
[92]This? 
[93]I agree. 
[94]You found it. 
[95]Okay, I'll give you that. 
[96]Look, I... 
[97]I gotta get going. 
[98]I really can't. I got a kid at home. 
[99]Boy. Daniel. 
[100]Nine. 
[101]It's not something I usually tell customers. Not exactly a turn-on. 
[102]That's very nice of you. Thank you. 
[103]Really? 
[104]One beer. 
[105]I think so. 
[106]He sure doesn't get it from his douchebag father. 
[107]Just this condo thing, down by Trenton. 
[108]Working on it. It's a great area. Way cheaper. And the schools are awesome. 
[109]I'm done. I'm quitting. 
[110]Where? 
[111]This isn't a dance place. 
[112]I've danced to this plenty. 
[113]Is this a lapdance I'm getting? 
[114]I think we can get you a shift. 
[115]Fuckin' eighties, man. Best shit ever. 
[116]The Crüe... 
[117]Like there's something wrong with having a good time. 
[118]"I'm from Seattle! I like rain!" 
[119]No shit... 
[120]No contact with the customers. 
[121]Shit. 
[122]I totally didn't realize the time. 
[123]I should get home. 
[124]Good night. 
[125]I'll do it later when it's quiet. 
[126]That's very sweet. Thank you. 
[127]I'm glad I could help. 
[128]On 46? 
[129]Randy. 
[130]I can't do this. 
[131]This. 
[132]I think you're awesome. You're a great guy. 
[133]You think I'm, like, this stripper, but I'm not. I'm a mom, with responsibilities. I don't think you wanna get with that. 
[134]I can't go there. 
[135]That was a mistake. 
[136]The club and the real world, they can't mix. 
[137]We didn't. 
[138]We didn't. 
[139]We didn't. 
[140]You're a customer. You're just a fucking customer. That's it. Okay? Got it? 
[141]What's that for? 
[142]Stop it. 
[143]Stop. 
[144]Fuck off. 
[145]Fuck off. 
[146]Hi. 
[147]Big Chris. Cheetah's bouncer. 
[148]Look, I'm sorry if I came off like a bitch. I didn't mean that stuff I said. You're not just a customer. 
[149]I'm sure it seems retarded, but I gotta keep that line. It's how I've been able to live with myself the last 12 years. 
[150]There's a place I'm trying to get to in my life. For me and my son. 
[151]I'm leaving that world behind. And I can't bring anybody with me who---- 
[152]Where are you going? 
[153]In bed by 11. Don't let him bargain. 
[154]Bye, monkey... 
[155]Pam. 
[156]There's waffles in the freezer and some burritos if he wants for lunch. He knows where. I'm not sure what time I'll be headed back yet. I'll keep you posted as I go. 
[157]Excuse me. 
[158]Do you know where the Civic Auditorium is? 
[159]Excuse me. 
[160]Randy. 
[161]Don't do this. This is dumb. 
[162]I thought the doctor... 
[163]You could really hurt yourself. 
[164]Out here's what counts. The real world. 
[165]I quit my job, drove 14 hours through the night to get here. What do you call that? 
[166]Randy. Please. 
[167]No. 
[168]Randy! 
[169]Stop it! Stop it, Randy!
dialogues.STEPHANIE:
[1]Is there someplace we can talk? 
[2]It won't take much of your time. 
[3]I'm here because... 
[4]I came to make amends. 
[5]I'm supposed to talk to people I've hurt. 
[6]
[7]Thank you. I'm sure you mean that. 
[8]I need to apologize. 
[9]For anything I've done or said over the years. All the anger at you. 
[10]Like the last time I saw you... I'm sorry for what I said. 
[11]Do you even know what I said? 
[12]What did I say? 
[13]You have no idea. 
[14]No problemo. 
[15]Same shit. 
[16]Same old shit. 
[17]I'm in the middle of saying something important and you drop it for the fucking wrestling. 
[18]It's like I'm 10 all over again. 
[19]This what? 
[20]Yeah. We're done. 
[21]What do you want? 
[22]Now's really not a good time. 
[23]Middlesex County Community. 
[24]That's okay. 
[25]Left at the second stop sign. 
[26]You gonna talk? 
[27]Okay... 
[28]You are such an asshole. 
[29]Now you wanna fix things. Now that suddenly you're all scared and alone from your heart attack. 
[30]This is so fuckin' you. You only come around when you need something from somebody, when they can do something for you. Selfish fuck. Good. Be alone. 
[31]What are you, stalking me? 
[32]Sometimes. 
[33]Oh. Okay. 
[34]I see that. What's it for? 
[35]I do. It's... shiny. 
[36]What am I doing? 
[37]We have an old favorite spot? 
[38]Now's not the best time. I've got some things to do. 
[39]Stuff. 
[40]No. 
[41]Always was a glutton for punishment. 
[42]I totally don't remember. 
[43]Thank you. 
[44]It was okay. 
[45]Bye. 
[46]Dinner? 
[47]I'm sorry. I don't think so. 
[48]Wednesday would work better. 
[49]I know that. 
[50]Please leave my house. 
[51]I can handle this. 
[52]I can handle this, Jen. 
[53]You're such a fucking asshole. 
[54]I waited in that restaurant two hours. Two fucking hours. Just in case you showed up late. "Maybe he got stuck in traffic. Maybe I got the time wrong"... Nope. 
[55]You didn't fuck up. You are a fuck- up. A walking, living, breathing fuck-up. 
[56]Just please shut the fuck up. Because I can't even stand the sound of your voice. 
[57]I thought about having a drink for the first time in 11 months last night. That's what you do to me. You asshole! 
[58]Fucking piece-of-shit asshole! 
[59]Get off me! 
[60]
[61]
[62]
[63]I don't mean it? 
[64]You're right. I don't. 
[65]I don't know why I got so hysterical. There's no reason. I don't hate you. I don't love you. I don't like you. I was stupid to think you could change. 
[66]I don't care. 
[67]Doesn't matter. I don't care. I'm done. No more fixing it. It's broke. Permanently. I'm cool with it. It's better that way. 
[68]I don't want to ever see you again. I don't wanna see you, I don't want to hear you... Done. You understand? 
[69]Actually, I don't care if you understand. 
[70]Goodbye. 
[71]You can come home. He's gone.
dialogues.WAYNE:
[1]Do we not know how to knock? 
[2]Let's try that again. 
[3]Come in! 
[4]Oh, hi, Randy! What can I do for you? 
[5]What's the matter, they raise the price of tights? 
[6]Let's see what we got. 
[7]Yeah? 
[8]Not really. What? 
[9]Only thing I got right now's got weekends. 
[10]Isn't that when you sit on other dudes' faces? 
[11]Deli counter. 
[12]All day long, hot horny housewives begging for your meat. And prepared salads. 
[13]At the moment. You interested? 
[14]Here ya go. 
[15]Guess they got it off your W-4. 
[16]Are you gonna be interacting with our valued Shop-Rite customers? 
[17]Then yes. 
[18]Just wear the fucking thing. 
[19]Let's pick it up. Rush hour. 
[20]
[21]Somebody call the cops!
dialogues.SCOTT BRUMBERG:
[1]Great show, Ram. Ya turned it out. As always. 
[2]Sorry. I was sure the gate'd be bigger. 
[3]Didn't think I'd see you here. 
[4]Heard you collapsed at the DiFusco show. Sounded pretty scary. 
[5]What? 
[6]No way! 
[7]Wow... Dude, you are good. 
[8]I was sure I'd have to cancel the minivan. 
[9]The one I rented for Fanfest. 
[10]Me and a whole gang's driving down. Terry C., Caggiano, Fatback... I am so fuckin' psyched. You see the flyer? 
[11]Volpe gave me an assload to pass out. 
[12]That is gonna be epic. 
[13]Should get a pretty good crowd today. 
[14]Sorry, man. 
[15]I was sure the turnout'd be bigger. 
[16]Ram! 
[17]How's tricks? Good to see ya, man. 
[18]So what brings ya by? 
[19]I thought you're retired. 
[20]See what we got...
dialogues.THE AYATOLLAH:
[1]That makes two in Columbus, one in Dayton. Next 12 months, I'd say Cincy's not out of the question. 
[2]Ram-A-Lam. 
[3]Good to see ya, bro. Didn't think we were gonna do this. 
[4]Thursday night, I get a call, "It's on! He's back in!" I'm like "What?" 
[5]What things? 
[6]Ah, we can just wing it. 
[7]It'll be fine. 
[8]How's this: I'm the heel, you're the face. Done. 
[9]Believe so. 
[10]Death to America! 
[11]Jesus. Relax. 
[12]That better? 
[13]Forgot how much fun this is. 
[14]Pathetic. Pitiful godless infidel! 
[15]Wanna take it home? 
[16]All you, bro. Lead the way. 
[17]If you ain't up to it... 
[18]Y'okay? 
[19]Just pin me. 
[20]Finish it. Pin me.
dialogues.LEX LETHAL:
[1]Ram. 
[2]There's some chick out here looking for you. 
[3]Some chick. 
[4]I don't think so. 
[5]Thanks for the lift, bro. 
[6]Nice. Two, two-fifty... You been there. The Ricky Whipsaw memorial benefit. 
[7]Should get a good gate. DiFusco says he's gotten like 20 calls last two days alone. 
[8]Cookie trays were better. 
[9]Hell, yeah. 
[10]Put him down. 
[11]You're okay, buddy. Hang on. 
[12]Stay with us, bro. Help's coming.
dialogues.NICK VOLPE:
[1]Listen up, only saying it once. Vic Storm, you're up first against D- Day. Second, Shawn McPride and Funkmaster Garry B. Slick. Third, Frankie Cirillo and Rob Dynamo versus J.T. Anvil and The Ultimate Freak. Fourth, Teddy Brewski and Lex Lethal. Intermission. Fifth, Samoan Savages versus the Disco Brothers. Sixth, the Irish Warrior and Vyper. Seventh, "Sandman" Steve Sambuca versus Hollywood. Last but not least, for the strap, Kid Loco versus Randy The Ram. Got it? Good. 
[2]Yo, Ram. Got a sec? 
[3]Do you realize what's coming up? 
[4]May 6th... 
[5]20th anniversary of you and Ayatollah at the Garden. 
[6]I know. Time fuckin' flies. 
[7]Two words: Re. Match. 
[8]I'm doing a big Fanfest thing down in South Carolina that weekend. I wanna main-event it with you two. 
[9]Ram-Ayatollah II. 20th anniversary. Hundreds, thousands of screaming fans watching you two make history for the second time. 
[10]For this? I bet he'd be willing to dust off the old turban.
dialogues.CUSTOMER:
[1]That's okay. 
[2]Yeah, could I get a... 
[3]Do I know you from somewhere? 
[4]You look so damn familiar. You Teamsters? 
[5]Half pound of Virginia ham and a half pound of the Jarlsberg. 
[6]You're not one of Mikey Bosch's buddies, are you? 
[7]Wait a sec. 
[8]Randy The Ram? 
[9]The old wrestler. From the '80s. 
[10]Ram Jam!
dialogues.ANNOUNCER:
[1]Ladies and gentlemen... 
[2]From Elizabeth, New Jersey, weighing in at 218 pounds... The former WWF superstar and wrestling legend... The one, the only... Randy "The Ram" Robinnnnsonnnnn! 
[3]And his opponent: From Hampton, Virginia, weighing in at 295 pounds... 
[4]Hellbilly Cannibaaaal! 
[5]From the Islamic Republic of Iran, weighing in at 252 pounds... The Tehran Terror, the Beast Of The Middle East... The Ayaaa-tooo-laaaaaah! 
[6]And his opponent... 
[7]From Elizabeth, New Jersey, weighing in at 219 pounds... 
[8]A true wrestling immortal, one of the greatest of all time... Randy "The Ram" Robinnnnsonnnnn!
dialogues.ADAM:
[1]What's that square? 
[2]That you're hitting me with. 
[3]That's a chair? 
[4]This is old. 
[5]That was, like, 50 years before I was born. 
[6]Coming! 
[7]I gotta go. 
[8]That's okay.
dialogues.BOOKER D:
[1]Randy The Ref! 
[2]Me and McPride was going over spots. We got this dope idea how to work you in. 
[3]You're gonna love this. Check it out. So McPride---- 
[4]What a screwjob. 
[5]Just reffing, my ass. I knew you'd get in there. 
[6]Yo, tell McPride shit-pit! 
[7]Fuckin' classic. 
[8]Ring rats, 12 o'clock.
dialogues.GREGG:
[1]I'm tellin' ya, bro, it's identical to the German. 
[2]Years ago, right? Mexican's way better now. 
[3]Bro, it's the same. 
[4]I don't have any. 
[5]What are you doing? 
[6]That's my own stash. That's my last one.
dialogues.WOMAN:
[1]The Hudson Acres, are they all on sale or just the regular? 
[2]It's a little unclear. 
[3]I'd prefer the maple-glazed, but if it's full price... 
[4]Which in your opinion is the best smoked ham? 
[5]I tried the Apple Valley Farms once, and it was very salty. Do you find that? 
[6]Could you please fuck someplace else? I gotta piss.
